pros: Small campus, if you can get a union position that is best because if you run into issues at least you have some union help. The staff who work in Aramark, and custodial are really friendly. Benefits and RRSP contributions are really great
cons:
-Human Resources does nothing to help employees who are experiencing issues with their superiors/management, which the majority of people in management shouldn't be there because they are terrible. 
-Parking is pretty expensive 
- Hardly ever closes even when storming, putting both students and employees at risk because you have to go to work
-More of an "everyone for themselves" mentality instead of team work
-Unless HR likes you, there's no room for movement in positions.

review_title: Great friendly environment and a lot of growth

cons:
- Change may be slow sometimes. Specially when it is about adopting new processes or technologies
- Some departments have good funding but some lack the financial flexibility
